content: yet another stockinette hat designed by jasmine davis yas it s time for a new hat knit in a super-soft cashmere blend this simple pattern is worked top down to help you make the most of your yardage starting with dpns you ll switch to circulars before finally using a tapestry needle to graft the live bottom stitches to the main body of the hat forming a warm doubled-up brim supplies gauge 1 ball knit picks capretta or 230 yards of 22 stitches and 36 row = 4 x4 lightweight fingering yarn square set of 5 size 2 double-pointed needles size 2 circular 16 or 40 for magic loop locking stitch marker tapestry needle waste yarn optional directions using dpns cast on 4 stitches taking care not to twist or drop stitches distribute one stitch to each of four needles join to work in the round round 1 kfb in each stitch 8 stitches round 2 kfb in each stitch 16 stitches at this point it can be helpful to place a stitch marker to show start of round round 3 knit round 4 on each needle k1 m1r knit to last stitch on needle m1l k1 24 stitches repeat round 3 and 4 until 128 stitches 32 on each needle change to circular needles and continue in plain stockinette stitch knit each stitch optional assistance for grafting 3 inches after the end of the increases place a lifeline and continue knitting when work reaches 12 inches or you have approx 2 yards of yarn left turn work inside out fold the live stitches up approx 3 inches and graft live stitches to stockinette taking care to graft to the same row throughout this is also where the lifeline comes in handy this video tutorial explains the grafting https //youtu be/dvo1llkfuys weave in yarn ends enjoy
